title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in artificial intelligence. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Principles of Artificial Intelligence
description: Advanced exploration of artificial intelligence covering current research and industry practices.

title: Intermediate Programming
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of programming. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Applied Software Engineering
description: In-depth analysis of software engineering principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Advanced Human-Computer Interaction
description: Rigorous treatment of human-computer interaction theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Cybersecurity
description: Interdisciplinary approach to cybersecurity combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Machine Learning
description: Rigorous treatment of machine learning theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Advanced Human-Computer Interaction
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of human-computer interaction. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: EEPS 325 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Human-Computer Interaction
description: In-depth analysis of human-computer interaction principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: EEPS 306 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Database Systems
description: Advanced exploration of database systems covering current research and industry practices.
prerequisites: EEPS 392 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Computer Graphics
description: In-depth analysis of computer graphics principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: EEPS 391 and senior standing or graduate status
